results.title: People's holiday
results.brief_description: Danish law provides that every worker in Demark is entitled to annual holidays in summer. Trades Unions and Workers Cooperatives have established Folk Ferie, an organization which arranges holidays and maintains youth hostels and beach holiday towns. Other activities include the provision of farm holidays for city industrial workers and the arrangement of international holidays.
results.description: Danish law provides that every worker in Demark is entitled to annual holidays in summer. results.title: People's dictator
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Chinese politician Deng Xiao Ping, a man who holds no official office in China, but runs the country as a virtual dictator. He has been credited as beign the one man who brought China from the brink of starvation to become one of the leading developing nations of the world. His policy of socialism is viewed by many in the West as being a form of Capitalism, but he will be remembered most by his people as the one dictator in 5,000 years of Chinese history who was determined to suppress a non-violent protest with extreme force - Tienamen Square.

results.title: People's century: 1900-1999
results.brief_description: ‘People’s century’ is a unique combination of rare archival footage and personal testimony that chronicles the 20th century. Through fascinating eyewitness accounts, this acclaimed BBC, WGBH/Boston co production examines how political, economic and technological changes transformed the lives of ordinary people. There are 26 episodes in the series (included on 8 tapes).

results.title: People
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Enterprise”.
Tom Novak, community college professor of Ethnic Studies, visits Ellis Island, where he reminisces about the early immigrants (16 million between 1890 and 1930) who helped shape America. Novak introduces us to some of their descendants in their homes and businesses. Japanese florists in California, Portuguese fishermen in Massachusetts and an Afro-American family in Long Island are featured. Narrated by William Shatner.

results.title: Pentuphouse
results.brief_description: An aging jazz singer (played with poignant resolve by Gillian Jones) must contend with her highly strung, drug using boyfriend. Director Cate Shortland traces with assured confidence the complex and delicate nuances of aging and compromise within a self destructive relationship.
results.description: An aging jazz singer (played with poignant resolve by Gillian Jones) must contend with her highly strung, drug using boyfriend. results.title: Pentuphouse
results.creator_credit: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson, Australian Film Commission and Red Carpet Productions
results.brief_description: Della is an ageing jazz singer who is in a destructive relationship with petty crim and drug user, Dale. This haunting and confident short film examines the betrayals and compromises of love and age. The cinematography and script are first rate and the performances by Gillian Jones and Aaron Blabey outstanding. Cast also includes Stephen Curry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cate Shortland, Anthony Anderson, Australian Film Commission and Red Carpet Productions

results.title: Pentridge: some ghosts and memories from the big house
results.creator_credit: Catherine Birmingham, Daniel Scharf and Daniel Scharf Productions
results.brief_description: An evocative record of Pentridge prison, one of Australia’s most infamous penal establishments. The notorious criminal Mark ‘Chopper’ Read joins author Ray Mooney and former guards, governors and fellow inmates to relate stories of the harsh conditions and camaraderie shared by prisoners until the prison’s closure in the early nineties.

results.title: Pentimento
results.material_description: video, interactive software, infra red lights and projection
results.brief_description: PENTIMENTO is based on real events which took place in the Blue Mountains on the outskirts of Sydney, during 1999, involving the discovery of an unidentified body. It fictionalizes these events to dramatize some of the key elements surrounding the murder and the sexual violence which formed its backdrop. It presents these events in the form of recollections from the point of view of a father, sister, brother and the crime scene itself.
